course_title: Applied evidence and clinical reasoning in sports and exercise physiotherapy practice

learning_outcomes.description: Understand the biological and behavioural basis for the physiotherapy and multi-disciplinary management of sports and musculoskeletal injuries and conditions.
Develop evidence-informed management plans for common injuries occurring from participation in sport, exercise and physical activity.
Develop effective exercise programs and management plans to facilitate athletes’ return to participation, sport and performance.
Understand the role of the sports healthcare team and industry professionals in the management of athletes with sports and musculoskeletal injuries and conditions.
Clearly and effectively synthesize and communicate evidence-informed practice understanding and recommendations for managing sports injuries to discipline experts.

assessments.task_description:
You will be required to demonstrate the ability to contribute to and work as part of a team with a common professional purpose. This will include planning and preparation, communication, contribution and active participation in all aspects of the problem/case based scenario learning series.

This is a pass/fail component and must be passed in order to achieve a passing grade in the course.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.assessment_title: Problem-Based Learning Viva Exams: Tendon and ligament injuries
assessments.task_description:
For each of the two problem-based/case-scenario learning activities on tendon and ligament injuries, you will be given a case scenario to work on as a group(s) over a 2-week period. A tutor will facilitate group learning. You will then present your response as a group in the form of a seminar to an expert on the following dates:

Tendon injuries - Friday 29th August

Ligament injuries - Friday 12th September

Following each seminar there will be a VIVA Voce (oral exam). This exam will be at least 2 days after the seminar, during which time you will reflect upon your learning, and your clinical practice. For the VIVA Voce you will receive 10 minutes perusal time and then a 10-minute oral exam. There will be 1 VIVA Voce for each of the 2 problem-based/case scenarios. Each VIVA Voce is weighted 17.5% of the total course. The VIVA Voce are scheduled on the following dates:

Tendon injuries VIVA Voce - Monday 1st September

Ligament injuries VIVA Voce - Monday 22nd September

Online vivas will be recorded and retained (as per UQ policy https://policies.uq.edu.au/document/view-current.php?id=184).

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

For the VIVA Voce you will receive 10 minutes perusal time and then a 10-minute oral exam. There will be 1 VIVA Voce for each of the 2 problem-based/case scenarios. Each VIVA Voce is weighted 17.5% of the total course. The VIVA Voce are scheduled on the following dates:

Online vivas will be recorded and retained (as per UQ policy https://policies.uq.edu.au/document/view-current.php?id=184).

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.task_description:
Students will deliver an individual presentation at a Musculoskeletal and Sports Physiotherapy Conference Day at the end of semester. The conference will be open to the wider physiotherapy profession. The student will collaborate with the co-ordination team to select a conference topic to present.

Podium presentations will be recorded and retained (as per UQ policy https://policies.uq.edu.au/document/view-current.php?id=184).

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

To pass this assessment, students will be required to demonstrate detailed comprehension of their written submission independent of AI and MT tools.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 4 To Week 13(18 Aug - 02 Nov)
learning_activities.topic:
Problems-based/case-scenario learning seminars

There will be 4 problems-based/case-scenario learning seminars, each with an associated Viva Voce. You will work as a group to address a case scenario and present your findings to an expert.
learning_activities.topic_description: Problems-based/case-scenario learning seminars There will be 4 problems-based/case-scenario learning seminars, each with an associated Viva Voce. You will work as a group to address a case scenario and present your findings to an expert.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 9 To Week 13(22 Sep - 02 Nov)
learning_activities.topic:
Podium presentation feedback sessions

Staff will facilitate sessions to provide feedback on the progress of your podium presentation. During these sessions you will receive feedback on your planning and development of your podium presentation from staff and your peers. You are also expected to provide feedback to your peers on their planning and development of their presentations.

You are also expected to provide feedback to your peers on their planning and development of their presentations.
